intro: Hypocalymma speciosum, commonly known as the pink ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink or purple flowers that appear in spring. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is typically found in sandy soils in arid regions. It is an erect shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
